author: Soroush Rahimian
comment: I have a Pebble smart watch and this app does not detect that I am connected. Therefore smart watch does not act as a trusted device. Also it asks me multiple times if my WiFi is a trusted device. After I say yes and confirm my pin, it forgets it and then asks again. Can't believe I spent money on this. How do I get a refund?
title: Confirming does not work with lollipop

author: Raymond Jones
comment: Have Moto G2 just upgraded to MM. Was using another program on KK and it stopped on upgrade to LP. Found another but it stopped working on upgrade to MM. This program works with trusted wi-fi and does what it says it does. Hopefully third time lucky and the devs continue with work on this app. Well done guys!

author: Tom Munson
comment: Bluetooth and WiFi work perfectly. Location-based locking/unlocking is hit or miss, even when it appears to have a correct location fix. I haven't tested Pebble or Wear. Update: Pebble doesn't work. Lost another star.
title: Works, sort of

comment: When ur product works, ur users do the advertising for u. Perfect rating for: clean, simplistic, material UI. Customizable options. Easy to toggle. Responsive developer. Fantastic app, I just hope u will include more ways of unlocking in a future update.

reply.author: Tusch Development
reply.content: Thanks for the review!  I just pushed an update to the Play Store that hopefully addresses the bug you are referring too.  If you are still experiencing problems, please email me at tusch.development@gmail.com so we can get your problem resolved. As far as more ways of unlocking the screen, I am definitely looking into that.  Thanks again.

title: Android 5.1 fixed!

author: Martin Toomajian
comment: The setup was complicated but it is working.  It doesn't seem to work well with Nougat Lineage ROM for my phone. I'm hoping for an update.

author: Say Ker Chan
comment: i can set 5 digit password but when want to unlock show is 4 digit. what is the problem here? now my phone can't be unlock, what should i do? please help to advise.

author: Jonathan Bryce
comment: It just seems really buggy to me. It seems to have no idea when I am and am not connected to a trusted Bluetooth device, so even when I'm connected to my smart watch out Bluetooth headphones, it asks for a pin. I installed this app to make using and unlocking my phone easier, but it has been nothing more than a complete nuisance. At best it's not particularly user friendly; at worst, it's a complete failure. It doesn't override the security settings of my phone so even when it reports that my Bluetooth device is connected and that the phone is unlocked, I still need to use the phone's default pin or pattern to unlock. I need the phone to open UNLOCKED when using GPS and connected to Bluetooth headphones on my motorbike. This app absolutely doesn't work with Xiaomi Mi Max

author: Christopher Newell
comment: Very handy software. Works smoothly with few issues. I'd like it to automatically lock when disconnecting from a trusted device, but not if I'm still connected to another trusted device. That's my only real beef with this app. Buy with confidence.
title: Works well on KitKat

author: j brown
comment: We all set our phones down I noticed, me less so. I keep a holster on me. Still I figured someone must have thought of a way to do just what you have done. Great product , I have no issues after a month strong. Moto g4 plus... no probs
title: Love it, great for radiology Dept.

author: Chris Bedlington
comment: Had VPN setup on my phone, when this app kicked in it wiped out the settings.  UPDATE: just received android 5.01 on my phone and their trusted device manager implementation does not delete the vpn connections. is there something that  can be done to prevent this, I really want to use this product again.
title: VPN connections get wiped out!

author: HPC HPC
comment: Works to keep my devices unlocked When on trusted wifi but doesn't lock it back when I leave trusted wifi. If I restart my device then it will lock again. If it would work to re-lock my device I would give it 5 stars.
title: Kind of works...

author: Debbie Good
comment: Does not work with Lollipop and won't let me uninstall.
title: Lollipop

author: Peter Steedman
comment: The ability to set trusted WiFi network sets this app far above Google's stock smart lock.
title: Better than smart lock

author: Radomir Pavlik
comment: Works for me. Xiaomi Mi3 with LG Urbane smartwatch. I can't only figure out how to disable swipe screen.

author: Gavin Grant
comment: Bluetooth works perfectly with my LG Urbane. Great app. Looking forward to future development and improvements
title: LG Urbane

author: Thomas Hallén
comment: Does not work with Lollipop
title: Lollipop

author: Amin Kaveh
comment: No need to type your pin code a dozens of times aday.  specially when you dont need that Extra security.
title: Rest your fingers

comment: Won't let me add a Bluetooth
title: Sucks

author: Thien Phuc
comment: Plz add it :)
title: No sony smartwatch 2

comment: This works well with my 5.1 android phone. I got great support getting started.
title: Works great

comment: Works great for my note 2 and Moto X Pure

comment: How to add devices

author: Samantha Combes
comment: Works fine so far... Very convenient
title: Working on lollipop

author: Katka Pejšková
comment: Loved it, I will buy the key
title: Works great

author: Brad Beck
comment: Don't use it

author: james davis
comment: Work's for me on MM miui8

author: Ryan R
comment: Nice app but resets the default unlock to the pin code every time it locks back the device. Would be nice if it didn't override it.
title: Pin code

author: Joyrul Rahman
comment: Android L includes smart unlock for Bluetooth, anyways I'm trying to use this for my Xiaomi Miband fitness tracker which has Bluetooth and use this app to use this for Smart Unlock of Bluetooth nearby, but can't seem to do it, good design of app material design
title: Very useful for KitKat owners

author: Andrei Altaras
comment: Works great and it's easy to set up. Been looking for this app for awhile
title: Works

author: Dale W
comment: Works great. I like the WiFi feature.
title: Works great.

author: And Apps
comment: I like it. I tried to do it with tasker, but it was not reliable and I didn't want to spend any more time debugging.  This is a great implementation for 4.x android. I use with Wear, Bluetooth, and Wi-Fi.
title: Works well and is reliable for me

author: Edward Tolson
comment: Works great and the developer is incredible with support.  He's won a big fan!
title: Works great

author: Sean Lovin
comment: Finally found one legit...thanks
title: LEGIT!!!

author: Steve Faktor
comment: The design is good, if it worked consistently. It doesn't. It disables lock security when you start the phone, only locks sometimes, and limited to numeric codes so encryption is not supported. Overall, stay away if you don't want to compromise your security.

reply.author: Tusch Development
reply.content: Sorry to hear your having so many problems! If you could email me at Tusch.Development@gmail.com (If you still have the app installed you can use "Bug Report" option) I would be happy to help / fix your issues. As far as encryption goes, if the device has full encryption enabled, this app will not work. Even if alphanumeric passwords were enabled.

title: So unreliable defeats the purpose of a security app

author: Winson
title: Bluetooth works well on my 4.1.2 Samsung S2. Try Wifi compatibility later.

author: Mark Topping
comment: Been using this for a day now, and been emailing the dev about a problem, which he's already fixed and submitted. That's service for you! Apart from no pattern unlock (Google's fault, not the devs), this app works a treat for me!
title: Great app for pre-lollipop!

author: Douglas Sandridge
comment: Too bad for me (us). Polished UI - and all the features I needed - only - it just doesn't work. Suspect another Google API change to make our lives miserable (but are we actually safer??). Please be innovative and find a way -or- this might be the end of the line. Good Luck!
title: Not Working - Google Nexus 7 (FLO - 2013)/Andriod L (5.01)

author: Tucker Haslett
comment: Only with I didn't have to use a pin code. Would rather use a pattern. Samsung note 4 - KitKat 4.4.4
title: Works well

author: Ricardo Coleta
comment: Doesn't work with my phone instead keep my phone unlocked while connect with trusted wifi or Bluetooth its lock anyway and I have to type password all the time.
title: Nexus 6

author: marc sheridan
comment: I've tried other similar but this seems to be the most reliable
title: Great
